article_title: 17-year-old Russian likely designer of Target malware

article_metadata.description: How old were you thinking he was? Beth Stebner of the New York Daily News reports: “A 17-year-old Russian national from St. Petersburg was responsible for the malicious programing that allowed for data from Target and Neiman Marcus to be compromised, according to a California-based security firm.

og.description: Best Buy's strategy stumble; Ortman challenges Franken record; airport expanding gambling; Dakota County's fitness efforts; outdoor winter baseball; one stadium lawsuit dropped; and more.
